page.title: 02TARRINGTON CHURCH
page.content: Dedicated to St Philip and St James was built in the second half of the 12th Century,stands on a hill overlooking the village.Stonebuilt with a tower,with a clock which faces west,has a peal of six bells. A roughly circular graveyard surrounds the church. The glass in the church is generally poor except for the window at the south-east corner of the chancel which contains a collection of fragments of 14th and 15th C arranged in panels. The church plate includes a late 17th Century cup and a pewter flagon. There was an incident during the Civil War when a Rector was murdered by a band of Cromwell's Soldiers. There are two rectories, The Old Rectory, now a private dwelling, and The New Rectory.
